column4: ok thanks, anyone know how to fix the black bootscreen problem?
i did Xorg -configure and it told me /root
when u go rescue mode and cd u start in /root so i guess thats why
i know but i cd to / i didnt know where i was so...
is it possible to use bash in irssi?
hmmm ok... ikonia: i mean if its part of irssi, to be possible to use bash in it.. kinda i suck at explaining
ok
ikonie: akrtvrvs told me how to, just /exec then command
ok thanks
well i cant use nano cause it juses terminal ui... whats a good simple text editor in cli?
err, uh? if you are in the CLI, then of course it will use the terminal "UI".
nano doesn't have any buttons
i really don't see why you'd use *any* text editor in irssi
if you can't open another terminal, you can just hit Ctrl+Z to temporarily stop irssi, then do "bg 1" to let irssi keep running, then edit your files.
then "fg" will get you back to irssi.
you're asking the wrong questions, seriously
snowhite, dom har en finast kanal där i #ubuntu-se, ni skulle pröva den
err... the default volume applet does just that?
gnome-alsamixer possibly, i don't know
if it doesn't have to be GNOME, then there's probably a few options
the KDE volume applet is a tray applet, for instance
how about you look at my !equivalents link, or for that matter you "apt-cache search cad | grep CAD"
